DataElement.preferredName: MRI Gadolinium Not Complete Other Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Other reason DCE-MRI portion with Gadolinium was not completed.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide amazingly clear and detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders._An element with atomic symbol Gd, atomic number 64, and atomic weight 157.25._An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction_.Complete; having every necessary or normal part or component or step; or having come or been brought to a conclusion.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide amazingly clear and detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.

Concepts.definition: Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.

Concepts.definition: An element with atomic symbol Gd, atomic number 64, and atomic weight 157.25.
An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.

DataElement.changeDescription: 11/4/12 jc  Add to ACRIN Context Imaging Modality-MRI CSI; remove from caBIG ACRIN CSIs.  1/16/09 Added to CSI for ACRIN Renal DCE-MRI.  1/6/08 - released for use in a C3D study; still needs final review an approval from ACRIN.  4/30/08 - created for ACRIN Breast DCE/MRI 6676-M3 & 6676-M4.
